Description: Fragment of undyed, plain weave linen with large ovoid/leaf-shaped tapestry (grouped warp threads) panel in purple wool, details in undyed linen; Inside panel is a repeating pattern of squares with interlaced borders around lozenges, framed with serrated leaves, at one end a lozenge on a stalk (detail missing from the other end); Inc. wrapped float brocading; Warp: linen, S spun, c. 14 tpc; Weft: linen and wool, S spun, c. 10 tpc in plain areas, c. 45 in tapestry; Edges: cut
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, green box; Probably from one end of a mantle; Edges cut since excavation; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (24.8.1989)
Condition: Fair,good in areas, wool disappeared from others; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
Acquisition notes: Collection purchased at sale on 6th Dec 1954, lots 154, 155 and 156.
